result.execSummary:
The defendant Zachary M. Woods was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Forgery-Uttering, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.38(2).
  • Forgery-Uttering, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.38(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Obtain or maintain full time employment or part time employment if enrolled in school.

May not vote or serve on a jury until civil rights are restored.
No firearms.
Provide DNA sample on 6-13-16.
Pay DNA surcharge.

Absolute sobriety to include no purchase, possession or consumption of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription and taken only as prescribed and as approved by agent.  
Defendant is not to be in the company of any person who is using, purchasing or possessing illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. 
Defendant is not to possess or consume any prescription medication without a valid prescription.  All prescriptions shall be verified by agent.
No contact with K.C. or L.C. without agent's prior knowledge and approval.  Court does not oppose defendant living with victims if approved by agent.

AODA assessment followed by treatment and aftercare.
Payment of court obligations and DOC supervision fees.
